task.title: Task: Gridlines
task.shortdesc: Adding and removing vertical and horizontal gridlines in a chart.

context.p: Gridlines are horizontal and vertical lines extending from the axes across the plot area of the chart. Gridlines make the data in a chart easier to read. You can show gridlines for the major or minor intervals on the axes. By default there are some gridlines added to most charts.

step.cmd: Click the Charts Element button, the plus sign next to the chart and you'll see a list of chart elements.
Click the continuation arrow of Gridlines and hover the cursor over the options.
step.stepresult: By each option you will see the result in the chart.
